data.title: Blade Runner 2049
data.text:
Thirty years after the events of the first film, a new blade runner, LAPD Officer K (Ryan Gosling), unearths a long-buried secret that has the potential to plunge what’s left of society into chaos. K’s discovery leads him on a quest to find Rick Deckard (Harrison Ford), a former LAPD blade runner who has been missing for 30 years

The much anticipated sequel, Blade Runner 2049, will be directed by Denis Villeneuve (Prisoners, Sicario), and stars Ryan Gosling, Harrison Ford, Ana de Armas, Sylvia Hoeks, Robin Wright, Mackenzie Davis, Carla Juri, Lennie James, with Dave Bautista and Jared Leto. The film is set to be released on October 6, 2017.

All Awards and Recognition

Academy Awards 2018 winners for Best Achievement in Cinematography (Roger Deakins) and Best Achievement in Visual Effects (John Nelson, Gerd Nefzer, Paul Lambert and Richard R. Hoover.)

BAFTA Awards 2018 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins) and Best Achievement in Special Visual Effects (John Nelson, Paul Lambert, Richard R. Hoover and Gerd Nefzer).

Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy & Horror Films, 2018 winner for Best Science Fiction Film.

Alliance of Women Film Journalists, 2018 winner for Best Cinematography

(Roger Deakins).

American Society of Cinematographers, 2018 winner for Outstanding Achievement in Cinematography in Theatrical Releases (Roger Deakins).

Art Directors Guild, 2018 winner for Fantasy Film.

Austin Film Critics Association 2018 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

Hollywood Film Awards 2017 winner for Producer of the Year (Andrew A. Kosove, Broderick Johnson and Cynthia Sikes).

North Texas Film Critics Association 2017 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

New Mexico Film Critics 2017 winner for Best Picture, Best Supporting Actor (Harrison Ford), Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins), and Best Production Design (Dennis Gassner)

North Carolina Film Critics Association 2018 winner Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

North Texas Film Critics Association 2017 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

Online Association of Female Film Critics 2018 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

Online Film & Television Association 2018 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins), Best Production Design (Dennis Gassner and Alessandra Querzola), Best Visual Effects (John Nelson, Gerd Nefzer, Paul Lambert and Richard R. Hoover).

Online Film Critics Society Awards 2017 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

Philadelphia Film Critics Circle Awards 2017 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

Phoenix Critics Circle 2017 winner for Best Science Fiction Film Achievement in Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

Phoenix Film Critics Society Awards 2017 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

Prix Aurora Awards 2018 winner for Best Visual Presentation (Denis Villeneuve).

San Francisco Film Critics Circle 2017 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

Satellite Awards 2018 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins) and Best Visual Effects

Seattle Film Critics Awards 2017 winner for Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins) and

Best Production Design (Dennis Gassner and Alessandra Querzola).

St. Louis Film Critics Association 2017 winner for Best Cinematography(Roger Deakins) and Best Visual Effects.

Utah Film Critics Association Awards 2017 winner for Best Adapted Screenplay (Hampton Fancher and Michael Green) and Best Cinematography (Roger Deakins).

Visual Effects Society Awards 2018 winner for Outstanding Created Environment in a Photoreal Feature (Chris McLaughlin, Rhys Salcombe, Seungjin Woo and Francesco Dell’Anna), Outstanding Model in a Photoreal or Animated Project (Alex Funke, Steven Saunders, Joaquin Loyzaga and Chris Menges),
